H0.text: Tornadoes are caused by the Coriolis Effect.

H1.text: Volcanoes are caused by the Coriolis Effect.

H2.text: Wind patterns are caused by the Coriolis Effect.

H3.text: Stationary fronts are caused by the Coriolis Effect.

A4.text: The Coriolis effect strongly affects the large-scale oceanic and atmospheric circulation, leading to the formation of robust features like jet streams and western boundary currents.

A5.text: The Coriolis force minutely changes the trajectory of a bullet, affecting accuracy at extremely long distances.
